alert.note: Alert for Buncombe (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 20 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Buncombe County through 645 PM EDT... At 600 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Downtown Asheville, or near West Asheville, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Asheville, Arden, Woodfin, Swannanoa, Weaverville, Biltmore Forest and Bent Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
